page.title: 11Perox Engineering
page.content: The firm gets its name from the two men who started the business in 1956 ,Mr.Perrett who provided the capital and Mr.Cox who had the engineering skill. The firm now employs fifteen men although at one time more than forty worked there. The main work carried out at the moment is the casting of aluminium teapot spouts. Perox were at one time the biggest single producer of teapot spouts in the country but are now second to a company in Birmingham.Casting is usually done once every week and as many as spouts are produced in each casting session.The company also produces braces which are used to reinforce large buildings.These are made out of the finest quality stainles steel and are specially designed for different buildings.
